# modules we'll use
# import pandas as pd
exec(os.environ['IREWR_IMPORTS'])
import numpy as np
# FIRST-AUTHOR: remove plotting
# import seaborn as sns
# import datetime

# read in our data
earthquakes = pd.read_csv("./input/earthquake-database.scaled.csv")
landslides = pd.read_csv("./input/catalog.scaled.csv")
volcanos = pd.read_csv("./input/volcanic-eruptions-database.scaled.csv")

# set seed for reproducibility
np.random.seed(0)

# print the first few rows of the date column
print(landslides['date'].head())

# check the data type of our date column
landslides['date'].dtype

# Your turn! Check the data type of the Date column in the earthquakes dataframe
# (note the capital 'D' in date!)
print("Data Type of Date column in Earthquakes data:",earthquakes['Date'].dtype)

# create a new column, date_parsed, with the parsed dates
landslides['date_parsed'] = pd.to_datetime(landslides['date'], format = "%m/%d/%y")

# print the first few rows
landslides['date_parsed'].head()

# Your turn! Create a new column, date_parsed, in the earthquakes
# dataset that has correctly parsed dates in it. (Don't forget to 
# double-check that the dtype is correct!)
# FIRST-AUTHOR: make notebook run
# earthquakes['Date']=pd.to_datetime(earthquakes['Date'],infer_datetime_format=True)
earthquakes['Date']=pd.to_datetime(earthquakes['Date'],infer_datetime_format=True,utc=True)
print(earthquakes['Date'].dtype)

# try to get the day of the month from the date column
# FIRST-AUTHOR: the first of the two lines below was added to get the notebook to run
landslides['date'] = pd.to_datetime(landslides['date'], infer_datetime_format=True)
day_of_month_landslides = landslides['date'].dt.day

# get the day of the month from the date_parsed column
day_of_month_landslides = landslides['date_parsed'].dt.day

# Your turn! get the day of the month from the date_parsed column
day_of_month_earthquakes=earthquakes['Date'].dt.day
print(day_of_month_earthquakes[:10])

# remove na's
day_of_month_landslides = day_of_month_landslides.dropna()

# plot the day of the month
# FIRST-AUTHOR: remove plotting
# sns.distplot(day_of_month_landslides, kde=False, bins=31)

# Your turn! Plot the days of the month from your
# earthquake dataset and make sure they make sense.
# remove na's
day_of_month_earthquakes = day_of_month_earthquakes.dropna()
